H0.text: What is the name of the Japanese sliding door or partition, made of a latticed screen covered with white paper. Akari

H1.text: What is the name of the Japanese sliding door or partition, made of a latticed screen covered with white paper. Byōbu

H2.text: What is the name of the Japanese sliding door or partition, made of a latticed screen covered with white paper. Fusuma

H3.text: What is the name of the Japanese sliding door or partition, made of a latticed screen covered with white paper. Shōji

A4.text: Shoji (障子) is a door, window or room divider used in traditional Japanese architecture, consisting of translucent (or transparent) sheets on a lattice frame.

A5.text: Where light transmission is not needed, the similar but opaque fusuma is used (oshiire/closet doors, for instance).
